name: Spicy Peanut Soup
description: Rich and spicy peanut soup is an ultra comforting and flavorful dish that everyone will love. The pantry staple ingredients make this hearty soup easy to prepare in just 30 minutes.
recipeIngredient: 1 medium sweet potato, peeled and diced
15 ounce can chickpeas, drained and rinsed
5 cups kale, stems removed and chopped
additional red chili flakes or hot sauce

recipeInstructions.text: Heat the olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the diced onion and sauté for 3-4 minutes, until translucent. Now add the garlic and ginger, and cook for 1 more minute, until fragrant. Add the diced sweet potato and cook for 2 more minutes, stirring constantly.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat the olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the diced onion and sauté for 3-4 minutes, until translucent. Now add the garlic and ginger, and cook for 1 more minute, until fragrant. Add the diced sweet potato and cook for 2 more minutes, stirring constantly.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the cumin, chili flakes, tomato paste, broth, peanut butter and chickpeas to the pot. Stir very well, until the tomato paste and peanut butter have mostly dissolved into the broth. Cover the pot and bring to a boil, then lower heat to a simmer and cook for 10-15 minutes, until the sweet potatoes have softened.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the cumin, chili flakes, tomato paste, broth, peanut butter and chickpeas to the pot. Stir very well, until the tomato paste and peanut butter have mostly dissolved into the broth. Cover the pot and bring to a boil, then lower heat to a simmer and cook for 10-15 minutes, until the sweet potatoes have softened.

recipeInstructions.text: Once the sweet potatoes have softened, use a large wooden spoon to mash some of the sweet potatoes against the side of the pot, which will help thicken the soup.
recipeInstructions.name: Once the sweet potatoes have softened, use a large wooden spoon to mash some of the sweet potatoes against the side of the pot, which will help thicken the soup.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the chopped kale, stir and cover the pot. Simmer for another 5-10 minutes, until the kale is tender. Taste; add more salt if needed or extra chili flakes for more spice.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the chopped kale, stir and cover the pot. Simmer for another 5-10 minutes, until the kale is tender. Taste; add more salt if needed or extra chili flakes for more spice.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve immediately with a scoop of rice, chopped cilantro, peanuts, hot sauce or more chili flakes, if desired. Enjoy!
recipeInstructions.name: Serve immediately with a scoop of rice, chopped cilantro, peanuts, hot sauce or more chili flakes, if desired. Enjoy!

recipeInstructions.text: Leftovers will keep for up to 4 days in the refrigerator or it can be frozen for up to 3 months.
recipeInstructions.name: Leftovers will keep for up to 4 days in the refrigerator or it can be frozen for up to 3 months.
